ygData.subject: Expanded Proposed 50 Project Storyline
ygData.msgSnippet: This is a re-listing of my storyline for the 50 Project, with notes about how the connections between scenarios should go.  I left places deliberately in there

Subject: Expanded Proposed 50 Project Storyline
Message-ID: <a05if5+dnrv@...>

This is a re-listing of my storyline for the 50 Project, with notes 
about how the connections between scenarios should go.  I left places 
deliberately in there to let you skip non-essential plot lines.  Will 
this proposal satisfy everyone?

Scenario 1 connects to scenario 2.
Scenario 1: Introduction to the game.  You heard about a city awarding 
a contract to guard it.  You and your friends are going to compete to 
win that contract.

Scenario 2 connects to scenarios 1 and 3-8.
Scenario 2:  You made it to the finals of the competition.

Scenario 3 connects to scenario 2.
Scenario 3: You have to defend the city's trees from foresters who 
want to chop it down.

Scenario 4 connects to scenario 2.
Scenario 4:  You have to defend the city's storehouses from bandits.

Scenario 5 connects to scenario 2.
Scenario 5:  You have to defend the city's water supply.

Scenario 6 connects to scenario 2.
Scenario 6:  You have to defend the city's gates from destruction.

Scenario 7 connects to scenario 2.
Scenario 7:  You have to defend the city's crops from faeries.

Scenario 8 connects to city scenario 2 and scenario 9.
Scenario 8: An invading army tries to besiege the city by keeping 
people from going and coming to the city.  You go out to meet the 
frontline defense.

Scenario 9 connects to scenarios 8 and 10.
Scenario 9:  You are ambushed from 2 different sides by the invading 
army.

Scenario 10 connects to scenarios 9 and 11.
Scenario 10:  The invading army is getting too close to the city for 
your comfort.

Scenario 11 connects to scenarios 10 and 12.
Scenario 11: The invading army is too powerfull so you have to evacute 
the citizens from the city.

Scenario 12 connects to scenarios 11 and 13.
Scenario 12:  You evacute the citizens into the forest.

Scenario 13 connects to scenarios 12 and 14.
Scenario 13: You have to guard the citizens while they sleep in the 
forest.  Note: this will 3-4 civilians surrounded by a fort with 
doors.

Scenario 14 connects to scenarios 13 and 15.
Scenario 14: You find an entire city occupied by the undead and decide 
to clear out it to make room for the citizens.  First, you have to get 
through the outer defenses.

Scenario 15 connects to scenarios 14 and 16.
Scenario 15:  You break into the city.

Scenario 16 connects to scenarios 15, 17, 21, and 24.
Scenario 16:  You finally remove the undead from the city.

Scenario 17 connects to city scenario 16 and scenario 18.
Scenario 17: A group of bandit clerics (who just robbed a bank) return 
to the city to reclaim it.

Scenario 18 connects to scenarios 17 and 19.
Scenario 18: You go after the remaining bandit clerics.

Scenario 19 connects to scenarios 18 and 20.
Scenario 19: You decide to return the treasure that the clerics stole. 
Unfortunately, thieves are waiting for you along the way.

Scenario 20 connects to scenarios 19 and 21.
Scenario 20: All you have to do is go into town, unnoticed to return 
the gold.  Unfortunately, that does not happen.  However, you know you 
will receive a reward.

Scenario 21 connects to scenarios 16, 20, and 22.
Scenario 21:  After being gone from the city a while, your men and you 
return to the city to find the city taken over.  You have to reconquer 
it.

Scenario 22 connects to scenarios 21 and 23.
Scenario 22:  You have to rescue the citizens held within the city..  
Note: this will have 2-4 prisoners in a protected cell with gates as 
doors; they won't appear until episode 24.

Scenario 23 connects to scenarios 22 and 24.
Scenario 23: You increase the defenses of your city while guarding it.

Scenario 24 connects to city scenarios 16, 23, and 25.
Scenario 24:  Hearing, that the defenses have weakened, you fight 
tooth-and-nail to reclaim the city you lost in the beginning.

Scenario 25 connects to scenarios 24 and 26.
Scenario 25:  You break through the city gates to face the few 
remaining soldiers inside.

Scenario 26 connects to scenarios 25 and 27.
Scenario 26: You escort the citizens back to their city while guarding 
them from hazards of the forest. Note: not a save-the-npc level, only 
2-4 citizens show up.

Scenario 27 connects to scenarios 26 and 28.
Scenario 27:  You are almost completely outside the forest, when you 
meet up with some bandits.  Only that is keeping you from reaching the 
city is the bandits.  Note: not a save-the-npc level, only 2-4 
citizens show up.

Scenario 28 connects to scenarios 27 and 29.
Scenario 28: You built a completely underground tunnel connecting the 
two cities.  Unfortunately, while digging, you disturb the undead and 
orcs.

Scenario 29 connects to scenarios 28 and 30.
Scenario 29: You station a small part of your forces in the 2nd city. 
 The majority of your army runs off to secure a newly nearly abandoned 
city.  Upon, entering the city you discover lots of clerics and mages.

Scenario 30 connects to scenarios 29 and 31.
Scenario 30:  After beating most of the clerics and the mages, you 
discover why the people fled: the clerics and mages were raising 
monsters.

Scenario 31 connects to scenarios 30 and 32.
Scenario 31: You venture off to win a contract to protect a fourth 
city, one with a harbor.

Scenario 32 connects to scenarios 31 and 33.
Scenario 32:  Your army surived the preliminary round, but must more 
difficult teams on a different terrain.

Scenario 33 connects to scenarios 32, 34, 37, and 43.
Scenario 33:  Your army has to face one final battle to win the 
contract; unfortunately, your back is turned towards the sea. 

Scenario 34 connects to scenarios 33 and 35.
Scenario 34: On your way back to the city, you are ambushed by men.  
Unfortunately, these men are using the same tactics you use.

Scenario 35 connects to scenarios 34 and 36.
Scenario 35: You had it coming by not screening new members of your 
army too well.  Someone from within your army has manage to gather 1/3 
of your forces against you.

Scenario 36 connects to scenarios 35, 37, and 43.
Scenario 36:  You have to defeat the last of the traitorous forces.

Scenario 37 connects to scenarios 33, 36, and 38.
Scenario 37: While you are rebuilding your forces, another large 
number army approaches to conquer your cities.  You send your men out 
to take out the 1st wave.

Scenario 38 connects to scenarios 37 and 39.
Scenario 38:  You hear that the army has fresh supplies at sea.  You 
move to board all those ships to keep the army from being resupplied.

Scenario 39 connects to scenarios 38 and 40.
Scenario 39:  You mobilize in the field to keep the some enemy troops 
from crossing a river.

Scenario 40 connects to scenarios 39 and 41.
Scenario 40:  You finally run into the bulk of the opposing army; 
unfortunately, the terrain is miserable for fighting.

Scenario 41 connects to scenarios 40 and 42.
Scenario 41: You leave 3/4 of your army to engage in a small skirmish 
with the opposing army so that you can take 1/4 and sneak up on the 
camp.

Scenario 42 connects to scenarios 41, 43, and 47.
Scenario 42:  With 1/4 of your army, you enter the last remaing enemy 
camp throug the back and  you slaughter the remaining forces.

Scenario 43 connects to scenarios 33, 36, 42, and 44.
Scenario 43: You find a map to an abandoned mine and you take a small 
part of your army to explore it.  Upon, entering the mine, you find it 
occupied by barbarians.

Scenario 44 connects to scenarios 43 and 45.
Scenario 44:  Upon going deeper into the mine, you find lots of gold, 
barbarians, and orcs.

Scenario 45 connects to scenarios 44 and 46.
Scenario 45:  Getting near the bottom of the mine, you find undead and 
monsters that were sealed away.

Scenario 46 connects to scenarios 45 and 47.
Scenario 46: A group of hired mercenaries try to steal the mine away 
from you.

Scenario 47 connects to scenarios 43, 46, and 48.
Scenario 47: Magic users have aligned to uproot you and your army.  
Taking out the first wave isn't too bad, considering most of them are 
unexperienced.

Scenario 48 connects to scenarios 47 and 49.
Scenario 48:  Fighting the second wave is horrible, because you keep 
running into magical creatures.

Scenario 49 connects to scenarios 48 and 50.
Scenario 49:  Your spies manage to find a major supply area for the 
magic users.  You decide to demolish the supplies and the forces 
inside.

Scenario 50 connects to scenario 49 [when we tackle the next 50 
project, we'll add a link to scenario 51 then].
Episode 50:  You finally nail down the last of the magic users to one 
location.  Unfortunately, their creations are still around.
